README.md.content:
Perfume Kiosk Prototype

This project contains the complete frontend and backend for a mock perfume vending kiosk.

1. Backend Setup

The backend handles order creation, payment processing with Razorpay (Test Mode), and simulating hardware dispatch commands.

Navigate to the backend/ directory:

cd backend


Install dependencies:

npm install


Configure Razorpay:

Log in to your Razorpay Test Dashboard.

Create a new set of Test API Keys.

Copy your Key ID and Key Secret into the backend/.env file.

RAZORPAY_KEY_ID=YOUR_TEST_KEY_ID

RAZORPAY_KEY_SECRET=YOUR_TEST_KEY_SECRET

Configure Webhooks (CRITICAL for payment verification):

You need a tool to expose your local server to the internet. localtunnel is a great free option.

Install it: npm install -g localtunnel

Run your backend: npm start (it will run on http://localhost:3001).

In a new terminal, run: lt --port 3001

localtunnel will give you a public URL, e.g., https://your-url.loca.lt.

Go to your Razorpay Test Dashboard -> Webhooks.

Add a new webhook:

Webhook URL: https://your-url.loca.lt/api/webhook/razorpay

Secret: my-super-secret-key (or change it in your .env file).

Active Events: Select payment_link.paid.

Run the backend server:

npm start


2. Frontend Setup

The frontend is a React app built with Vite, using Zustand, TanStack Query, and Shadcn/UI components.

Navigate to the frontend/ directory:

cd frontend


Install dependencies:

npm install


Run the development server:

npm run dev


Open your browser to http://localhost:5173 (or whatever URL Vite provides).

How the Test Payment Flow Works

Select Perfume & Pumps: Use the UI to make a selection and click "Pay".

API Call: The React app sends a request to your local backend (POST /api/create-order).

Razorpay Order: Your backend talks to Razorpay's API to create a dynamic Payment Link and QR code.

QR Code Display: The backend sends the QR code URL back to the React app, which displays it.

Make Payment:

Open your phone's UPI app (like PhonePe, GPay).

Scan the QR code.

Use one of Razorpay's test UPI IDs (e.g., success@razorpay) to "pay".

Authorize the payment on your phone.

Webhook Confirmation:

Razorpay's server (Test Mode) will detect the "successful" payment.

It will send a payment_link.paid event to your localtunnel URL.

Your backend's webhook handler (/api/webhook/razorpay) will verify the signature and update the order status to PAID in its mock database.

Polling:

Meanwhile, the React app is polling your backend (GET /api/status/:orderId) every 2 seconds.

As soon as the webhook updates the status, the next poll will see status: "PAID".

Dispense:

The app automatically moves to the "Dispense" screen.

Click the "SIMULATE PHYSICAL BUTTON PRESS" button.

Hardware Mock:

This click calls your backend (POST /api/dispatch/:orderId).

The backend verifies the order is PAID (the critical safety check).

It updates the status to DISPENSING, logs a "command" to the console, and simulates the time it takes to pump.

Once the simulation is done, it updates the status to DISPATCHED and tells the frontend, which moves to the "Complete" screen.
